intro: Phacelia glechomifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. Its leaves are broad and opposite, with a distinctive heart-shaped base. Phacelia glechomifolia is often used in ecological restoration due to its ability to attract pollinators and stabilize soil.
